page.title: 14THE RIVER TAMAR.
page.content: Apart from about three miles the river forms the geographical border between Devon and Cornwall.Its source is located North of Bude and its estuary is at Plymouth. As far as we are concerned, the river runs through beautiful farmland,much of the river bank being tree-lined. The river is a great focal point for fishermen as it abounds with trout and salmon. It drains the area and is a source of water for the many cattle that graze alongside its banks. The occasional otter has been spotted from time to time. Often the river floods, in the winter, bringing silt into the fields therefore making them very fertile and giving excellent grazing for cattle. The river hams are rarely ploughed.
